member.name: T:Proton.Parser.ParseNode
member.summary: Represents a node in the parse tree used during syntax analysis. Each node may contain a single token or a list of tokens, and optional left and right child nodes.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.#ctor(Proton.Lexer.Token)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a single token.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{Proton.Lexer.Token})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a list of tokens.
member.param: The list of tokens this node represents.

member.name: P:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.ParseSymbol
member.summary: Gets or sets the primary token represented by this parse tree node.

member.name: P:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.ParseSymbolsList
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of tokens associated with this node, used when the node represents a collection of tokens.

member.name: P:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.Left
member.summary: Gets the left child node in the parse tree.

member.name: P:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.Right
member.summary: Gets the right child node in the parse tree.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.SetLeft(Proton.Parser.ParseNode)
member.summary: Sets the left child of this node. Can be overridden by derived classes.
member.param: The node to set as the left child.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.SetRight(Proton.Parser.ParseNode)
member.summary: Sets the right child of this node. Can be overridden by derived classes.
member.param: The node to set as the right child.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.ToCode
member.summary: Converts the contents of the token list to a formatted code string.
member.returns: A string representation of the node's token values.
